DataElement.preferredName: Repeat Nuclear Radiology Imaging Hepatic Perfusion or Location Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term that represents the location or perfusion of radioisotope determined by a repeat of nuclear medicine scan.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Repeat Nuclear Radiology Imaging Procedure Hepatic Perfusion And/Or Location
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Make or do or perform again._Any type of imaging method that uses radioactive materials._Pertaining to, affecting, or associated with the liver._The passage of fluid through the vessels of a specific organ or tissue._Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid._A position, site, or point in space where something can be found.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Make or do or perform again.:Any type of imaging method that uses radioactive materials.

Concepts.definition: Make or do or perform again.
Any type of imaging method that uses radioactive materials.

Property.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to, affecting, or associated with the liver.:The passage of fluid through the vessels of a specific organ or tissue.:Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.:A position, site, or point in space where something can be found.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to, affecting, or associated with the liver.
The passage of fluid through the vessels of a specific organ or tissue.
Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.
A position, site, or point in space where something can be found.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Tests, examinations, evaluations used to determine a subject's status or response to intervention.
ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: Created initially to support CCR value domain for CTMS.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.: A unique macroscopic (gross) anatomic structure that performs specific functions.  It is composed of various tissues.  An organ is part of an anatomic system or a body region.  Representative examples include the heart, lung, liver, spleen, and uterus.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

A unique macroscopic (gross) anatomic structure that performs specific functions. It is composed of various tissues.  An organ is part of an anatomic system or a body region. Representative examples include the heart, lung, liver, spleen, and uterus.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not accompanied by another or others; exclusive of anyone or anything else.: A triangular-shaped organ located under the diaphragm in the right hypochondrium. It is the largest internal organ of the body, weighting up to 2 kg. Metabolism and bile secretion are its main functions. It is composed of cells which have the ability to regenerate.

Concepts.definition: Not accompanied by another or others; exclusive of anyone or anything else.

A triangular-shaped organ located under the diaphragm in the right hypochondrium. It is the largest internal organ of the body, weighting up to 2 kg. Metabolism and bile secretion are its main functions. It is composed of cells which have the ability to regenerate.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The quality or state of consisting of elements that are not of the same kind or nature.

Concepts.definition: The quality or state of consisting of elements that are not of the same kind or nature.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: To a complete degree or to the full or entire extent.: A triangular-shaped organ located under the diaphragm in the right hypochondrium. It is the largest internal organ of the body, weighting up to 2 kg. Metabolism and bile secretion are its main functions. It is composed of cells which have the ability to regenerate.: The quality or state of being similar or comparable in kind or nature or of being uniform throughout in composition or structure.

Concepts.definition: To a complete degree or to the full or entire extent.

A triangular-shaped organ located under the diaphragm in the right hypochondrium. It is the largest internal organ of the body, weighting up to 2 kg. Metabolism and bile secretion are its main functions. It is composed of cells which have the ability to regenerate.
The quality or state of being similar or comparable in kind or nature or of being uniform throughout in composition or structure.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Tests, examinations, evaluations used to determine a subject's status or response to intervention.
ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: Created initially to support CCR value domain for CTMS.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.
